newsitem.title: CHINA: China provinces focus on same industries.
newsitem.headline: China provinces focus on same industries.

text.p: Too many of China's provinces and cities are focusing on the same industries, causing an excess of low-output enterprises in some sectors, the Workers' Daily said on Wednesday.

Out of China's 29 provinces and provincial-level municipalities, 22 took the automotive industry as their industrial base while 24 took electronics as their pillar industry, it said quoting statistics from the State Planning Commission.
There were currently 122 automobile manufacturing enterprises spread across 28 provinces and cities with total annual output of 1.5 million vehicles, it said.
Eleven of these provinces had an annual output of under 50,000 vehicles and nine provinces produced fewer than 5,000 vehicles a year, it said.
By the end of 1995, China had 26 provinces producing television sets, 23 provinces manufacturing refrigerators and 23 provinces making washing machines, it said.
